newsitem.title: GERMANY: ABN AMRO cuts Deutsche to sell from hold.
newsitem.headline: ABN AMRO cuts Deutsche to sell from hold.

text.p: ABN AMRO Hoare Govett said on Tuesday it had cut its recommendation on shares in Deutsche Bank AG to "sell" from "hold" following the bank's 1996 earnings report last week.
ABN AMRO said there appeared to be "little fundamental reason" for Deutsche's shares' outperformance in the past three months.
It also said it viewed as "clearly negative" the bank's reluctance to report earnings per share acording to the DVFA method, the usual method of analysis used in Germany.
"Because of the uncertain outlook (for earnings), the current lacks in cost controls and a share price near a 12-month high of 95 marks .. we recommend taking profits," ABN AMRO said.
